Baoguo is the base town serving Emeishan National Park. Its crammed full of buses carting domestic Chinese tourists about. Prices are somewhat hiked because its really just a tourist hub.
at the end of Baguo is a good place to check out. It includes a hand-hewn waterfall, some carvings in a cliff and a giant copper bell.
There are some hot springs housed in a fancy hotel if you wanted to check that out.
Plenty of shops to stock up on cheap(er) snack food before your climb.

Teddy Bear Hotel has food.

Up a couple of side streets towards the mountain from Teddy Bear Hotel are some cheap, roadside eateries. Steamed buns are good sustenance for your hike! (The ones wrapped in corn skin are the most flavoursome.)
There is a bar across the river from the rest of town.

value: content=The original budget accommodation in Emei Shan. Located  next to the Baoguo bus station. Dorms (¥30), single (¥80-100), double/twin (¥80-200 depending on amenities) and triples (¥150-200). All rooms come with a bathroom.   They also offer free hiking information and free pickup from Emei Bus/Train station. Includes a restaurant with quite good food.

Bus 5 ("gongchur ooo") and then bus 1 ("gongchur yao") to get to
bus station ("urrr may chur jan"). Alternatively, a taxi should be ¥15.
